channel.title: Other Tests :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Testing for Other Issues Letâ€™s consider the scenario where our routes/api.js file was modified slightly to have some incorrect code in it: // -=-=- other code omitted here -=-=- router.get('/', function (req, res, next) { res.json([ { versoin: "1.0", url: "/api/ver1/" } ]) }) In this example, we have misspelled the version attribute, and also used an incorrect URL for that version of the API. Unfortunately, if we actually make that change to our code, our existing unit test will not catch either error!
